description: From Middle English were, from Old English wer, from werian (“to dam up”), from Proto-West Germanic *warjan, from Proto-Germanic *warjaną, from Proto-Indo-European *wer- (“to cover”); Cognate with Old Norse ver (“station for fishing”), Sanskrit वृणोति (vṛṇóti). Related to warranty.

entries.meaning: An adjustable dam placed across a river to regulate the flow of water downstream.
examples: The weir must not represent a physical barrier to fish migration, both locally and throughout the whole river system. If necessary, a fishway is included in the weir.

entries.meaning: A fence placed across a river to catch fish.
examples: The weir catch of mackerel at Monomoy and along Cape Cod has been a failure.
